turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Virgo (album).
turn.1: What was the name of Virgo's debut album?
turn.2: Virgo (album) Virgo is the eponymous debut studio album by American house music duo Virgo, released in 1989 on Radical Records in the United Kingdom.
turn.3: What was the name of their first album?
turn.4: It compiles two 12" EPs released in the United States on Trax Records, "Do You Know Who You Are?" by Virgo Four and "Ride" by M.E..
turn.5: Who did the band consist of?
turn.6: Both were pseudonyms of Eric Lewis and Merwyn Sanders, two art students and childhood friends from Chicago.
turn.7: When was their first album released?
turn.8: The album was first reissued in 2010 on Rush Hour Recordings.
turn.9: What type of music did they play?
turn.10: While rooted in the Chicago house style, "Virgo" features a distinctive sound that is dreamier and more introspective than that of the duo's contemporaries, also incorporating elements of acid house and deep house.
turn.12: Although Lewis and Sanders made no effort to promote the album, its idiosyncratic music and the mystery surrounding the band's identity turned it into an underground cult classic over the years.
